result.execSummary:
The defendant Shane A. McNamar was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Restitution to be determined within 30 days.  Defense has two weeks to object after restitution has been determined.
Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant shall write a letter of apology to the victim due within 30 days of plea and sentencing and preapproved by probation.  Defendant shall undergo any other counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.  Defendant shall obtain his GED/HSED or high school diploma through the Medford Adult Academy.
 Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.
Defendant shall comply with an AODA and comply with any treatment recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: DOC Receipt
Letter to Judge from Victim Witness Coordinator
In Court Notice to Defendant After Sentencing
Associated with Charge #1
of N.E.G.

Attorney Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Shane A. McNamar appeared in person with his Attorney Wright Laufenberg.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Victim rights have been complied with.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 1.  Plea colloquy.  Plea freely voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court finds defendant guilty of Counts 1.  Court dismisses and read in Count 2.   Statement by Counsel.  Statement by defendant.  Court orders on Count 1 - withheld sentence - probation for 3 years with conditions of court costs; DNA sample and surcharge; AODA and comply with treatment recommendations; restitution joint and several to be determined within 30 days and defense has two weeks to object after restitution has been determined; letter of apology to the victim due within 30 days of plea and sentencing and preapproved by probation; any other counseling as deemed appropriate by probation; complete his GED/HSED or high school diploma through the Medford adult academy.  Appeal rights given to defendant.  - rt
Days Credit Worksheet
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 17, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Shane A. McNamar in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State filed its standard motions.  Defense has not filed any motions.  No objection by defense regarding state's motions.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 21, 2016 at 08:30 am.  - rt
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.
Motion hearing on May 25, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Written

Court calls case Nos. 15CF82, 15CF83, 15CF84, 15CF85, 15CF87 and 15CF90.  Defendant Shane A. McNamar in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waiver of preliminary hearing filed - based on waiver court bound DE over for trial.  Information filed by the state.  DE waived further reading of same and entered pleas of not guilty to all the charges.   Atty Laufenberg requests to file motions for discovery and to file motions. Court grants requests.   State filed motion to revoke bond on all cases.  Argument.  15CF82 - Court orders $5,000.00 cash be forfeited. 15CF83 - Court orders $500.00 cash be forfeited.  Court will not forfeit signature bonds at this time.  Motion hearing scheduled for May 25, 2016 at 02:00 pm. ba

Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the court. Defendant shall comply with booking procedures at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department. Defendant shall have no contact with N.E.G.-dob: 03-28-1995. Defendant shall not possess or consume controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Arrest Report

Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant appeared by video in custody. Court found probable cause for the arrest. Court advised DE of possible charges and penalties. Court advised DE of right to attorney.  Notice of right to attorney given to defendant.  State requested a $1,000.00 cash bond with conditions of: booking; no contact with N.E.G.; no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Court ordered bond with conditions as requested.  Initial appearance set for November 17, 2015 at 1:00 p.m. - ba
